clinical_study.brief_title: Hand in Hand. Psychological Support and Counseling to Breast Cancer Patients and Their Partners
clinical_study.official_title: Hand in Hand. Psychological Intervention for Breast Cancer Patients and Their Partners. A Randomised, Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the effect of a psychological intervention to breast cancer patients and their partners compared to a control group receiving usual care

detailed_description.textblock:
The intervention intends to improving the patient and partners well-being, quality of life and their relationship adjustment.
The couples in the intervention group participates i six to eight couple sessions. The sessions is conducted by an experienced psychologist and takes place one to five months after the patients cancer diagnosis. The control group receives usual care.
The framework of the intervention is attachment theory and the psychologists support and advise the couples in talking candidly about their feelings regarding their new life situation with cancer. The psychologist focus on the couples ability to feel comfortable and safe in each others presence.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Impact of Event Scale (IES)
primary_outcome.description: IES assesses traumatic reactions to the breast cancer diagnosis. Assessed by both patients and partners

primary_outcome.measure: Change in The Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)
primary_outcome.description: Assesses feelings of anxiety and depressive symptoms. Assessed by both patients and partners.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in The Profile of Mood States - Short Form (POMS-SF)
primary_outcome.description: Assesses mood changes. Assessed by both patients and partners

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Dyadic Adjustment Scale - Revised (DAS-R)
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses relationship functioning and marital satisfaction. Assesed by both patients and partners
RQ provides a profile of an individual's attachment feelings and behaviour. Assessed by both patients and partners

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Breast (FACT-B)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 weeks post-intervention and 10 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses health-related quality of life with additional questions for women dignosed with breast cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - general population (FACT-GP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 weeks post-intervention and 10 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses health-related quality of life. Assessed by partners

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 weeks post-intervention and 10 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses individual fellings of fatigue. Assessed by the patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Post Traumatic Growth Inventory
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses positive changes in individuals experiencing traumatic life events. Assessed by both patients and partners

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 2 weeks post-intervention and 10 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Assesses health-related quality of life. Assessed by both patients and partners

intervention.description: Couples in the intervention group attends six to eight couple-sessions performed by a psychologist.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women newly diagnosed with a primary breast cancer (in the last 4 weeks)
- Women cohabiting with a male partner in a romantic relationship
- Patient and partner speaks and reads danish
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients having a previous cancer diagnosis
- Neoadjuvant therapy for breast cancer
- Previous hospital admission with diagnosed psychotic episodes
